input_root_dir.description: Root directory name. Use a name different from the project name if you intend to use monorepo

input_cloud.description:
Select cloud. 
Choose from azure, aws

input_cicd_platform.description:
Select CICD platform. 
Choose from github_actions, github_actions_for_github_enterprise_servers, azure_devops

input_databricks_staging_workspace_host.description:
URL of staging Databricks workspace, used to run CI tests on PRs and preview config changes before they're deployed to production. Default: 
Azure - https://adb-xxxx.xx.azuredatabricks.net
AWS - https://your-staging-workspace.cloud.databricks.com

input_databricks_prod_workspace_host.description:
URL of production Databricks workspace. Default: 
Azure - https://adb-xxxx.xx.azuredatabricks.net
AWS - https://your-prod-workspace.cloud.databricks.com

input_default_branch.description: Name of the default branch, where the prod and staging ML resources are deployed from and the latest ML code is staged. Default:

input_release_branch.description: Name of the release branch. The production jobs (model training, batch inference) defined in this stack pull ML code from this branch. Default:

input_read_user_group.description: User group name to give READ permissions to for project resources (ML jobs, integration test job runs, and machine learning resources). A group with this name must exist in both the staging and prod workspaces. Default:

input_include_feature_store.description:
Whether to include feature store. 
Choose from no, yes

input_include_mlflow_recipes.description:
Whether to include mlflow recipes. 
Choose from no, yes

input_include_models_in_unity_catalog.description:
Whether to use the Model Registry with Unity Catalog. 
Choose from no, yes

input_schema_name.description: Name of schema to use when registering a model in Unity Catalog. Note that this schema must already exist.
